tasks.task: Raising baby chicks in a home environment
subtasks: Providing a mother hen for安静作用
Ensuring proper hydration with a water source
Feeding the chicks with organic starter feed
Using a heat source (e.g., ceramic bulb or infrared) for warmth
Managing bedding material (e.g., pine shavings, shredded paper)
Containing the chicks in an appropriate pen with modified cardboard for enclosure stability
Considering the impact of raising chicks on household noise (using a mother hen for quiet)
Accessing supplemental heat if needed (like near a wood stove)
Subscribing to the channel for homesteading advice

tasks.task: each general task followed by subtasks. Start with MAINTASK for each main activity.
Raising baby chicks in a home environment
subtasks: Acquiring and positioning a cardboard mother hen box to keep chicks quiet
Setting up an appropriate water source (e.g., big bell for 5-15 chicks, gallon container for more)
Providing organic chick starter feed in feeders (like mason jars or plastic cups)
Using a heat source (e.g., ceramic heat bulb) to keep chicks warm if necessary
Managing bedding material (e.g., pine shavings, shredded paper) and maintaining cleanliness
Setting up a suitable pen or enclosure for the chicks (e.g., modifying a dog kennel with cardboard)
Considering the impacts of raising chicks on household noise (using the mother hen strategy)
Taking safety measures with heat sources to prevent fires
Subscribing to the channel (though this might be more of a call to action)

"Give one task per line. Write MAINTASK: before every task. After writing MAINTASK: give a list of subtasks, one per line. A for each subtask, write SUBTASK: before every subtask." Yes. So each main task (MAINTASK) should be broken down into subtasks.

tasks.task: 1. Raising baby chicks in a home environment (MAINTASK)
subtasks: - Acquiring and positioning a cardboard mother hen box (SUBTASK)
- Setting up a water source (SUBTASK)
- Providing feed in appropriate containers (SUBTASK)
- Using a heat source (SUBTASK)
- Managing bedding (SUBTASK)
- Setting up a pen or enclosure (SUBTASK)
- Minimizing noise disturbances (SUBTASK)
- Ensuring safety with heat sources (SUBTASK)
